explanations.summary: Vasoconstriction uses IP3/DAG pathway: alpha-1 receptors activate PLC → IP3 releases Ca²⁺ from SR → contraction. cGMP causes RELAXATION (NO pathway). cAMP causes RELAXATION (beta receptors).

whyCorrect.d: IP3 (inositol trisphosphate) mediates vasoconstriction. Alpha-1 receptors activate phospholipase C → IP3 → Ca²⁺ release from sarcoplasmic reticulum → smooth muscle contraction → vasoconstriction.

whyIncorrect.a: cGMP activation causes VASODILATION, not constriction. NO activates guanylyl cyclase → cGMP → relaxation.
whyIncorrect.b: cAMP stimulation causes VASODILATION. Beta-2 receptors → adenylyl cyclase → cAMP → relaxation.
whyIncorrect.c: cGMP stimulation causes VASODILATION via NO pathway.
